185739677.review:
Is £20 for a 4 hour campaign fair? No.
Is £10 on sale for a 4 hour campaign fair? Also no.

This game is, at time of review, 18 years old, and has no business costing as much as it does for how little you get. You get what feels like, I wanna say six missions overall? I feel like £5 is more this game's speed, but hey, I'm a cheap asshole.

You shoot people and... Well, I mean, that's it... Oh, and you throw grenades.  

I take issue with the part in the Chernobyl mission where you lay on the grass and enemies walk by you. I genuinely feel like the game bugged out there because I kept getting spotted? I even decided to place my nose directly into MacMillans large intestine. I could smell his MREs digesting because my nostrils booked a 2 week all-inclusive to his anus. Eventually it just worked? I don't even know what I did differently, but whatever. That segment was dumb. Otherwise it was fine. The other stupid annoying part was that mission where you start off with the heavy machine gun on a hill. Eventually you have to push through enemies to get evacuated and I was trying to play it all serious and methodical but I was just getting popped through the smoke or vegetation over and over because the hostile npcs have fucking wallhacks. I gave up and just fucking booked it to the gas station, and it worked? Soap MacTavish: SAS operator and professional speed-runner, apparently.

The AC-130 segment was pretty fun, though it's the only specialist role you get. I thought there would be a tank segment in there somewhere but no such luck.

I guess pick it up if you want a really short campaign with very few set-pieces. You kinda just clear rooms. You don't get £20 worth of rooms though, that's for damn sure. You switch between the SAS and the USMC and then go to the YMCA and do CBT while enjoying a BJ and some DP.

184935744.review:
Modern Warfare has this reputation for being one of the absolute best games in the series. I haven't played all of them, but I will say that the game is at the very least fun. I played Campaign only and enjoyed the story beats. While I found it generic at points, I will say that the game is very good at making a high stakes situations. Very good at making you think "If I don't get this done, my squad will die, my team will die, my nation will die." I just think the individual moments are better than the story overall.

Played on Regular Campaign, still died a few times but I had a lot of fun. I very rarely play shooting games like this anymore so I had a lot of fun going back to an old COD game, one I've never experienced before, and play through it. I didn't play the game back in its hayday, but I could see why a lot of people are fond of this game.

I didn't play the multiplayer, I only played for the campaign so I can't comment on it. This game is fun, but I really don't recommend getting the game on Steam when it's cheaper to buy it on console for the same experience. The price of this game doesn't go down further than 10 quid, 

Overall, I recommend giving this game a shot. But I would recommend a dozen games over it. It's a fun game and I enjoyed playing it, but it's not a game I consider to be a masterpiece.

But if you want to turn your brain off and shoot some guns, this game is for you.

184863749.review:
I tried picking this game up at two different occasions, years apart, to give it an honest try and I have really mixed feelings about it. 

On the one hand, I really do appreciate the theme park that Infinity Ward has created for us, giving the player a seat in every ride, from the sniping level to the air support mission in the C-130. It's a complete experience that looks cool even today.

On the other hand, imagine this: enemies are pouring out in front of you and shooting in your direction. What do you do? If you are a sane person, you answered something along the lines of, "call for air or artillery support to soften the enemy position and try to suppress them with machine guns from your position, while another group flanks them from the side." In any case, you would not move out of cover, towards the enemies who are standing in the open and shooting at you, unless you had absolutely no other option. But that is what the game constantly forces you to do, as the enemy NPC's keep respawning in front of you, until you are directly on top of them. Tactical movement just gets you killed or makes you run out of ammo. The most effective thing to do in this game is to run directly into the face of the enemy as quickly as possible and shoot them from up-close. So the action ends up feeling like a cheap action movie. You are constantly getting hit with bullets, which would mean end of story in the real life, but here you soak the bullets up like a sponge and it is simply part of the gameplay. 

So, what happens is that I constantly tell myself to just power through the dumb part, to see the next cool thing, soaking up the bullets and running to the next chest-high wall, so that I can "recharge" my health and then repeat the same process all over again. I hate that so f*cking much.

If you don't mind this heavy-handed process, however, the game is worth playing for the spectacle and the relatively good vocal acting.

183924694.review: Der Einstieg in die Modern Warfare-Reihe war ein absoluter Spielhingucker. Mit einer fesselnden Kampagne, die in die Schattenwelt moderner Kriegsführung eintaucht und einem Multiplayer-Modus, der eine Ära geprägt hat, setzte dieses Spiel neue Maßstäbe. Missionen wie "All Ghillied Up" sind bis heute legendär und demonstrieren die unglaubliche Liebe zum Detail, Spannung und Abwechslung. Das Spiel legte den Grundstein für die Popularität moderner Kriegssettings und bleibt ein zeitloser Klassiker.

183834957.review:
[h2] Call of Duty® 4: Modern Warfare® (2007)[/h2]

Prepare-se, soldado. Você está prestes a embarcar em uma jornada épica que redefiniu os jogos de tiro em primeira pessoa para sempre. Call of Duty® 4: Modern Warfare® não é apenas um jogo, é uma obra-prima cinematográfica que te coloca na linha de frente de uma guerra moderna, onde cada bala conta uma história.

De cara, somos apresentados a uma narrativa intensa, quase palpável, que mistura ação explosiva com momentos de tirar o fôlego. O jogo te joga direto no caos, alternando entre diferentes perspectivas: você será o lendário Capitão Price, o destemido Soap MacTavish, e até mesmo um artilheiro em um bombardeiro AC-130. Cada missão é memorável, desde o stealth tenso em "All Ghillied Up" até o final arrebatador que ficará marcado em sua memória para sempre.

Os gráficos, para 2007, eram impressionantes e continuam a resistir ao teste do tempo. O som é outra joia: cada disparo, explosão e comunicação pelo rádio foi meticulosamente projetado para mergulhar você no calor da batalha. E a trilha sonora? Um verdadeiro espetáculo que amplifica cada momento.

O multiplayer é onde Modern Warfare realmente solidifica seu legado. Os mapas icônicos, a progressão viciante, e as killstreaks inovadoras criaram um padrão que moldou toda uma geração de jogos online. Quem não se lembra do caos controlado de "Crash" ou das batalhas estratégicas em "Crossfire"?

Call of Duty® 4: Modern Warfare® não é apenas um jogo, é uma lição de design, narrativa e inovação. É o tipo de experiência que define não só uma franquia, mas toda uma indústria. Seja você um veterano voltando para reviver os bons tempos ou um novato descobrindo o clássico pela primeira vez, este é um campo de batalha que vale a pena explorar.

Nota final: 10/10.
"Price, Soap... missão cumprida."
